sen.j: 桜井市（さくらいし）は、奈良県中部、中和地域に位置する市。
sen.e: Sakurai City is a city located in the middle of Nara Prefecture, Chuwa Area.
Sakurai City is a city located in the middle of Nara Prefecture, Chuwa area.
sen.cmt: Areaの頭文字を小文字に変更
sen.e: Sakurai City is a city located in the middle of Nara Prefecture, Chuwa area.

sen.j: 縄文時代や弥生時代の土器の欠片が一般の畑などでも見られるなど歴史の深さを窺わせる。
sen.e: This city has a long history: fragments of clay pots of the Jomon period and the Yayoi period can be found in ordinary fields.
This city has a long history: fragments of clay pots of the Jomon period and the Yayoi period can be found in ordinary fields.
This city has a long history: fragments of clay pots of the Jomon period and the Yayoi period can be found in ordinary fields.

sen.j: また、弥生時代や古墳時代の前方後円墳などの古墳が多く今日まで残っている。
sen.e: A lot of ancient tumbs including keyhole-shaped mounds of the Yayoi period or the Kofun period (tumulus period) have remained until nowadays.
A lot of ancient tombs including keyhole-shaped mounds of the Yayoi period or the Kofun period (tumulus period) have remained until nowadays.
A lot of ancient tombs including keyhole-shaped mounds of the Yayoi period or the Kofun period (tumulus period) have remained until nowadays.

sen.j: そのことからヤマト王権の中心的な地域であったと考えられる。
sen.e: Therefore, this city is thought to have been a central area in Yamato Dynasty.
Therefore, this city is thought to have been a central area in the Yamato Dynasty.
sen.cmt: in the Yamato Dynastyとしました。
sen.e: Therefore, this city is thought to have been a central area in the Yamato Dynasty.

sen.j: その前期には三輪王権とも言われるが、今日の三輪地域を指していると見られる。
sen.e: The earlier part of Yamato Dynasty is also called as Miwa sovereignty, and 'Miwa' is thought to suggest present-day Miwa area.
The earlier part of the Yamato Dynasty is also called the Miwa sovereignty, and 'Miwa' is thought to suggest present-day Miwa area.
sen.cmt: the Yamato Dynasty、the Miwa sovereigntyとし、called as→calledに修正
sen.e: The earlier part of the Yamato Dynasty is also called the Miwa sovereignty, and 'Miwa' is thought to suggest present-day Miwa area.

sen.j: 三輪の日本最古の神社といわれる大神神社や長谷寺、多武峰の談山神社や等弥神社などの由緒ある社寺も数多く見られる。
sen.e: Sakurai city has a lot of historically famous shrines and temples, including Omiwa-jinja Shrine, which is called the oldest shrine in Miwa, Hase-dera Temple, Tanzan-jinja Shrine and Tomi-jinja Shrine in Tonomine.

Sakurai City has a lot of historically famous shrines and temples, including Omiwa-jinja Shrine, which is called the oldest shrine in Miwa, Hase-dera Temple, Tanzan-jinja Shrine and Tomi-jinja Shrine in Tonomine.

Sakurai City has a lot of historically famous shrines and temples, including Omiwa-jinja Shrine, which is called the oldest shrine in Miwa, Hase-dera Temple, Tanzan-jinja Shrine and Tomi-jinja Shrine in Tonomine.

sen.j: 宗教的にも歴史が深く古代信仰の形体を知る上でも重要な地区である。
sen.e: Since the city has a long histroy from the religious viewpoint, it is a very important area to study "forms of ancient religions.
Since the city has a long histroy from the religious viewpoint, it is a very important area to study "forms of ancient religions."
sen.cmt: クォーテーション不足分追加
sen.e: Since the city has a long histroy from the religious viewpoint, it is a very important area to study "forms of ancient religions."

sen.j: また、土舞台（現桜井公園）は日本芸能発祥の地と言われ、“万葉のあけぼのの地”などと呼称されることもある。
sen.e: Tsuchibutai (present-day, Sakurai park) is called to be the birthplace of public entertainment and is sometimes called as "Manyo-no-akebono-no-chi (place of the dawn of Manyo)."
Tsuchibutai (present-day, Sakurai park) is said to be the birthplace of public entertainment and is sometimes called "Manyo no akebono no chi" (place of the dawn of Manyo).
sen.cmt: is called to be→is said to be、called as→calledとし、クォーテーションの位置を移動、ハイフン消去
sen.e: Tsuchibutai (present-day, Sakurai park) is said to be the birthplace of public entertainment and is sometimes called "Manyo no akebono no chi" (place of the dawn of Manyo).

sen.j: 2006年（平成18年）9月1日には、市制50周年という節目を迎え、市としての新たなる一歩を踏み出した。
sen.e: Sakurai became became a city after amalgamation on September 1, 2006 and made a new start.
sen.cmt: 「合併」という節目、と考えました。
sen.e: Sakurai City marked its 50th anniversary on September 1, 2006 and made a new start as a city.
sen.cmt: 原文の空欄部分をウェブで確認し転記、訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: Sakurai City marked its 50th anniversary on September 1, 2006 and made a new start as a city.

sen.j: 市西部および北部は奈良盆地の東南に位置し、寺川や初瀬川（大和川）が流れる比較的平坦な田園地帯で、桜井駅 (奈良県)および三輪駅周辺や国道165号沿線を中心として市街地を形成している。
sen.e: The western and northern parts of the city are located to the southeast of Nara Basin and form a relatively flat rural zone; this area constitutes of a downtown location, the center of which are Sakurai Station (Nara Prefecture), places around Miwa Station and along Route 165.

The western and northern parts of the city are located to the southeast of Nara Basin and form a relatively flat rural zone; this area constitutes of a downtown location, the center of which are Sakurai Station (Nara Prefecture), places around Miwa Station and along Route 165.

The western and northern parts of the city are located to the southeast of Nara Basin and form a relatively flat rural zone; this area constitutes of a downtown location, the center of which are Sakurai Station (Nara Prefecture), places around Miwa Station and along Route 165.

sen.j: 南部から東部にかけては竜門山地がそびえ立ち、その冷涼な気候を利用して大和茶や素麺の生産が行われている。
sen.e: From the southern to the eastern part, Ryumon Mountain District soars, and the cool climate enables to produce Yamato-cha tea leaves and somen (Japanese vermicelli).
From the southern to the eastern part, Ryumon Mountain District soars, and the cool climate enables to produce Yamato-cha tea leaves and somen (Japanese vermicelli).
From the southern to the eastern part, Ryumon Mountain District soars, and the cool climate enables to produce Yamato-cha tea leaves and somen (Japanese vermicelli).

sen.j: なお、山間部の集落では過疎化が著しく、麓の市街地とは対照的な表情を見せている。
sen.e: Settlements in the mountain area have serious depopulation problems, which makes a contrst with the situation of downtowns at the foot of mountains.
Settlements in the mountain area have serious depopulation problems, which makes a contrast with the situation of downtowns at the foot of mountains.
Settlements in the mountain area have serious depopulation problems, which makes a contrast with the situation of downtowns at the foot of mountains.

sen.j: 奈良県統計
1889年（明治22年）4月1日、村制施行により十市郡に桜井村がおかれる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1889, Sakurai Village was established in Toichi County according to the enforcement of the village system.
On April 1, 1889, Sakurai Village was established in Toichi County according to the enforcement of the village system.
On April 1, 1889, Sakurai Village was established in Toichi County according to the enforcement of the village system.

sen.j: 1890年（明治23年）11月18日、町制施行により桜井町となる。
sen.e: On November 18, 1890, Sakurai Village was changed into Sakurai Town according to the establishment of a municipal organization.
On November 18, 1890, Sakurai Village was changed into Sakurai Town according to the establishment of a municipal organization.
On November 18, 1890, Sakurai Village was changed into Sakurai Town according to the establishment of a municipal organization.

sen.j: 1893年（明治26年）5月23日、大阪鉄道（現桜井線）開業。
sen.e: On May 23, 1893, Osaka Railway (Sakurai Line at present) was set up.
On May 23, 1893, Osaka Railway (Sakurai Line at present) was set up.
On May 23, 1893, Osaka Railway (Sakurai Line at present) was set up.

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）3月29日、十市郡が式上郡・式下郡と合併し磯城郡が発足。
sen.e: On March 29, 1896, Toichi County was merged with Shikijo and Shikige Counties to become Shiki County.
On March 29, 1896, Toichi County was merged with Shikijo and Shikige Counties to become Shiki County.
On March 29, 1896, Toichi County was merged with Shikijo and Shikige Counties to become Shiki County.

sen.j: 同郡の所属となる。
sen.e: Sakurai Town belonged to that County.
Sakurai Town belonged to that County.
Sakurai Town belonged to that County.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月10日、磯城郡城島村を編入。
sen.e: On March 10, 1942, Shikishima Village of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai Town.
On March 10, 1942, Shikishima Village of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai Town.
On March 10, 1942, Shikishima Village of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai Town.

sen.j: 1954年（昭和29年）3月3日、磯城郡安倍村・多武峯村及び朝倉村を編入。
sen.e: On March 3, 1954, Abe, Tonomine and Asakura Villages of Shiki County were incorporated into Sakurai Town.
sen.cmt: 安倍村の読み方はAbeと判断しました。
sen.e: On March 3, 1954, Abe, Tonomine and Asakura Villages of Shiki County were incorporated into Sakurai Town.
On March 3, 1954, Abe, Tonomine and Asakura Villages of Shiki County were incorporated into Sakurai Town.

sen.j: 1954年7月、笠間・安田の2大字を宇陀郡榛原町_(奈良県)に境界変更。
sen.e: In July, 1954, a boundary was changed and as a result, two 'Oaza' of Kasama and Yasuda belonged to Haibara-cho, Uda County (Nara Prefecture).
In July, 1954, a boundary was changed and as a result, two 'Oaza' of Kasama and Yasuda belonged to Haibara-cho, Uda County (Nara Prefecture).
In July, 1954, a boundary was changed and as a result, two 'Oaza' of Kasama and Yasuda belonged to Haibara-cho, Uda County (Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: 1956年（昭和31年）9月1日、磯城郡大福村及び香久山村を編入・市制施行して桜井市となる。
sen.e: On September 1, 1956, Daifuku and Kaguyama Villages of Shiki County were incorporated into Sakurai Town, which became Sakurai City according to the enforcement of municipal organization.
On September 1, 1956, Daifuku and Kaguyama Villages of Shiki County were incorporated into Sakurai Town, which became Sakurai City according to the enforcement of municipal organization.
On September 1, 1956, Daifuku and Kaguyama Villages of Shiki County were incorporated into Sakurai Town, which became Sakurai City according to the enforcement of municipal organization.

sen.j: ※同日、大阪府では、和泉市が発足する。
sen.e: *On the same day, Izumi City was established in Osaka Prefecture.
On the same day, Izumi City was established in Osaka Prefecture.
On the same day, Izumi City was established in Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 1956年9月30日、磯城郡上之郷村を編入。
sen.e: On September 30, 1956, Kaminogo Village of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai City.
On September 30, 1956, Kaminogo Village of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai City.
On September 30, 1956, Kaminogo Village of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai City.

sen.j: 大字池尻・南山・戎外・木之本・下八釣・膳夫・出合及び出垣内を橿原市に境界変更。
sen.e: A boundary was changed, and as a result, Oaza Ikejiri, Minamiyama, Kaige, Kinomoto, Shimo Yatsuri, Kashiwade, Deai and Dekakiuchi belonged to Kashiwara City.
sen.cmt: 大字池尻,南山、出垣内の読み方は確定できませんでした。
sen.e: A boundary was changed, and as a result, Oaza Ikejiri, Minamiyama, Kaige, Kinomoto, Shimo Yatsuri, Kashiwade, Deai and Degaito belonged to Kashiwara City.
A boundary was changed, and as a result, Oaza Ikejiri, Minamiyama, Kaige, Kinomoto, Shimo Yatsuri, Kashiwade, Deai and Degaito belonged to Kashiwara City.

sen.j: 1959年（昭和34年）2月23日、磯城郡初瀬町を編入。
sen.e: On February 23, 1959, Hase-cho of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai City.
On February 23, 1959, Hase-cho of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai City.
On February 23, 1959, Hase-cho of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai City.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）4月1日、磯城郡大三輪町を編入。
sen.e: On April 1, 1963, Omiwa-cho of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai City.
On April 1, 1963, Omiwa-cho of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai City.
On April 1, 1963, Omiwa-cho of Shiki County was incorporated into Sakurai City.

sen.j: 1969年（昭和44年）4月1日、角柄・柳の2大字を榛原町に境界変更。
sen.e: On April 1969, a boundary was changed, and as a result, two Oaza of Tsunogawara and Yanagi belonged to Haibara Town.
sen.cmt: 柳の読み方を確定できませんでした。
sen.e: On April 1, 1969, a boundary was changed, and as a result, two Oaza of Tsunogawara and Yanagi belonged to Haibara-cho.
sen.cmt: 「1日」→訳漏れのため訳出、Haibara-choとしました。
sen.e: On April 1, 1969, a boundary was changed, and as a result, two Oaza of Tsunogawara and Yanagi belonged to Haibara-cho.

sen.j: 奈良県各地の木材の集散地であるため、製材業が盛んである。
sen.e: Since Sakurai is a distribution or trading center, lumbering is active.
Since Sakurai is a distribution or trading center for wood from different areas in Nara Prefecture, lumbering is active.
sen.cmt: 「奈良県各地の木材の」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。
sen.e: Since Sakurai is a distribution or trading center for wood from different areas in Nara Prefecture, lumbering is active.

sen.j: そのため“木の町”と有名で、木材製品の展示会や木材の工作室を子供たちや市民に対して開かれるなど、木材の振興も盛んである。
sen.e: Therefore, Sakurai is famous as "a wood town"and the city actively promotes its wood such as holding fairs of wood products and opening workshop using wood for children and the local people.
Therefore, Sakurai is famous as "a wood town"and the city actively promotes its wood such as holding fairs of wood products and opening workshop using wood for children and the local people.
Therefore, Sakurai is famous as "a wood town"and the city actively promotes its wood such as holding fairs of wood products and opening workshop using wood for children and the local people.

sen.j: ウンシュウミカンの生産地としても有名で、山間部では蜜柑の生産農家が多い。
sen.e: Sakurai is also famous as a place for producing satsuma mandarin (Citrus unshiu) and a lot of farms produce satsuma mandarin in the mountain area.
Sakurai is also famous as a place for producing satsuma mandarin (Citrus unshiu) and a lot of farms produce satsuma mandarin in the mountain area.
Sakurai is also famous as a place for producing satsuma mandarin (Citrus unshiu) and a lot of farms produce satsuma mandarin in the mountain area.

sen.j: また副業として手延べ素麺を製造している兼業農家も多く、その手延べ素麺は日本三大手延べ素麺“三輪素麺”として全国に知られ愛好者も多い。
sen.e: Many part-time farmers produce hand-streached fine white noodles as their side business, and the noodles are famous as "Miwa Somen," one of the three greatest hand-streached fine noodles in Japan and are greatly loved.

Many part-time farmers produce hand-stretched fine white noodles as their side business, and the noodles are famous as "Miwa Somen," one of the three greatest hand-stretched fine noodles in Japan and are greatly loved.

Many part-time farmers produce hand-stretched fine white noodles as their side business, and the noodles are famous as "Miwa Somen," one of the three greatest hand-stretched fine noodles in Japan and are greatly loved.

sen.j: 農閑期に製造、発注等々されるため、ほとんどがパートタイマーの主婦などを雇用している。
sen.e: Since the noodles are ordered and produced in an off-season for farmers, most workers are homemakers who work part-time.
Since the noodles are ordered and produced in an off-season for farmers, most workers are homemakers who work part-time.
Since the noodles are ordered and produced in an off-season for farmers, most workers are homemakers who work part-time.

sen.j: 博物館
埋蔵文化財センター

交通
大阪方面へ通勤、通学するため近鉄大阪線を利用する客が多く、朝夕の桜井駅は大変混雑する。
sen.e: Since a lot of people commute to Osaka by using Kintetsu Osaka Line, Sakurai station is very crowded in the mornings and evenings.
Since a lot of people commute to Osaka by using Kintetsu Osaka Line, Sakurai Station is very crowded in the mornings and evenings.
sen.cmt: stationの頭文字を大文字に変更
sen.e: Since a lot of people commute to Osaka by using Kintetsu Osaka Line, Sakurai Station is very crowded in the mornings and evenings.

sen.j: また京都方面への通勤、通学客も見られ、京都まで直通列車がある大和八木駅へ行くため近鉄大阪線を利用する客も多い。
sen.e: Others commute in the direction to Kyoto and many use Kintetsu Osaka Line to go to Yamato-Yagi Station, where they can go directly to Kyoto.
Others commute in the direction to Kyoto and many use Kintetsu Osaka Line to go to Yamato-Yagi Station, where they can go directly to Kyoto.
Others commute in the direction to Kyoto and many use Kintetsu Osaka Line to go to Yamato-Yagi Station, where they can go directly to Kyoto.

sen.j: 正月の大神神社に訪れる初詣客は、主にJR桜井線を利用し三輪駅は普段の数十倍混雑する。
sen.e: Visitors to Omiwa-jinja Shrine for 'hatsumode (the practice of visiting a shrine or temple at the beginning of the New Year)' mainly use JR Sakurai Line, and at that time Miwa Station is dozens of times as crowded as usual.
